key_title: Key to the species of Silene

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Caryophyllaceae

source.author: Adams, L.G.
source.title: Caryophyllaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Adams, L.G. (1996). Caryophyllaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Capsule-teeth 5; styles 5
Capsule-teeth 6–10; styles 3–5
Plants densely white tomentose; petals entire to emarginate; leaves more than 10 mm wide
Plants green, sparsely hairy; leaves grass-like, mostly less than 10 mm wide; petals 2-lobed or 4-lobed
Styles 5; capsule with 10 teeth
Styles usually 3 and capsule with 6 teeth
Plants glabrous; corolla pink, 25–30 mm diam.
Plants softly hairy; corolla white, or if pink then less than 25 mm diam.
Plant perennial; calyx teeth triangular; corolla pink, 13–25 mm diam
Plant annual or biennial; calyx teeth lanceolate; corolla white, 25–30 mm diam.
Calyx 20- or 30-veined
Calyx 10-veined
Calyx 30-veined, shortly pubescent
Calyx 20-veined, glabrous, glaucous
Seed dorsal edge sharply grooved between 2 undulate wings
Seed dorsal edge flat to more or less grooved but not winged
Petals often absent; calyx tube strongly hairy on veins; capsule 6–7.5 mm long
Petals always present; calyx tube usually glabrous; capsule 7.5–11 mm long
Capsules more than 15 mm long; plants glandular, espically on upper parts; night-flowering
Capsules less than 15 mm long; plants glandular or not; night- or day-flowering
Petal limb entire, c. 10 mm long or more; carpophore c. 10 mm long; inflorescence a loose dichasium
Petal limb entire to deeply bifid, to 8 mm long; carpophore <5 mm long; inflorescences of raceme-like simple or branched monchasia
Petal limb entire to emarginate; calyx glandular-hairy; day-flowering
Petal limb deeply bifid; calyx eglandular-hairy; flowers generally opening fully in low-light (cloudy weather, dusk or night)
Carpophore <1.5 mm long; petal-limb c. 1.5 mm long
Carpophore 1.5–4 mm long; petal-limb 4–8 mm long
